article_title: Mild Weather Week Continues In OK, Fire Threat Remains High - News9.com - Oklahoma City, OK - News, Weather, Video and Sports
article_text:
Skies say clear Wednesday night and the wind subsides quite a bit in central Oklahoma. Temperatures will cool into the mid-40s Thursday morning.

A cold front comes through early Thursday. Our wind will shift to the north and pick up between 15 to 30 mph. Temperatures will still climb to the upper 70s under sunny skies. The fire threat will be high.

Friday looks to be the best day of the week with seasonal temperatures in the low 70s and a fairly light north wind.

Stay with News 9, we’ll keep you advised.

Temperatures will still climb to the upper 70s under sunny skies.
Friday looks to be the best day of the week with seasonal temperatures in the low 70s and a fairly light north wind.
Skies say clear Wednesday night and the wind subsides quite a bit in central Oklahoma.
Our wind will shift to the north and pick up between 15 to 30 mph.
The fire threat will be high.
